evidence.text: a. The imposition of a $5 premium penalty on automatic re-enrollees, through the addition of 45 C.F.R. § 155.335(a)(3) and (n) and revisions to 45 C.F.R. § 155.330(j);

extracted.value: The imposition of a $5 premium penalty on automatic re-enrollees

evidence.text: b. The revocation of guaranteed insurance coverage for individuals with past-due premiums, through revisions to 45 C.F.R. § 147.104(i);

extracted.value: The revocation of guaranteed insurance coverage for individuals with past-due premiums

evidence.text: c. The failure to reconcile policy in 45 C.F.R. § 155.305(f)(4), including the final rule’s amendments to that policy through the addition of 45 C.F.R. § 155.305(f)(4)(iii);

extracted.value: The failure to reconcile policy in 45 C.F.R. § 155.305(f)(4)

evidence.text: d. The imposition of eligibility verification for the special enrollment period, through the revisions to 45 C.F.R. § 155.420(g);

extracted.value: The imposition of eligibility verification for the special enrollment period

evidence.text: e. The imposition of a requirement that Exchanges verify household income inconsistencies when a tax filer’s attested projected annual household income differs from “trusted data sources,” through revisions to 45 C.F.R. § 155.320(c)(3)(iii) and the addition of 45 C.F.R. § 155.320(c)(3)(vi)(C)(2);

extracted.value: The imposition of a requirement that Exchanges verify household income inconsistencies

evidence.text: f. The changes to the de minimis ranges for actuarial value calculations, through revisions to 45 C.F.R. §§ 156.140(c), 156.200(b)(3), and 156.400;

extracted.value: The changes to the de minimis ranges for actuarial value calculations

evidence.text: g. The changes to the policy regarding self-attestation of projected income, through revisions to 45 C.F.R. § 155.320(c)(5).

extracted.value: The changes to the policy regarding self-attestation of projected income
